column4: fork, system, execl, getpid, getppid, wait, waitpid,  perror and exit. <-- i need their man entries, how can i get them?
maybe you're using a different version of ubuntu - but mine does NOT have those
and I wouldn't expect they would those are kernel specific
apparently, try it, sudo apt-get install manpages-dev, they are there
I don't do kernel development - sorry I can't help -- now mvs - that's a different story - that and RSX I do know the internals
fork was born in RSX land
to fork a process is to send it from kernel process status, to a non-priveleged state to continue processing
i.e. nmi vs mi (non-maskable interrupts vs maskable interrupts)
im lost, im kind of a beginer :(, but you know your stuff
yes, but you don't need to know how a car engine works, to drive a car - neither do you need to know the internals of linux to use it.
you are absolutely right. But you need to learn to drive it before you hop in the drives seat
